newsitem.title: USA: U.S. debt futures end with large gains, near highs.
newsitem.headline: U.S. debt futures end with large gains, near highs.

text.p: U.S. debt futures ended with large gains and hugging day's highs when the market built on the morning's rise after the five-year Treasury note auction.
The auction produced a 6.165 percent high yield compared to forecasts for a 6.17/18 percent. The bid-cover ratio was 2.79 and non-competitive bids totaled $412 million.
Traders characterized response to the the auction, especially after Tuesday's lukewarm reception for the two-year issue, as average to fairly warm.
"The chit-chat before the auction was that it was going to go fairly decent," said one T-bond futures floor broker.
"The five-year went pretty well," said another floor broker.
"It (five-year auction) was okay," said a third T-bond futures floor broker. "But I don't think it was a big deal."
Traders also said futures began firming again near midday when a dealer bought some 2,000 December futures minutes before the contract went off the boards at noon, which also buoyed values.
The move upward caused more shorts to bail out and also triggered buystops, the brokers agree, all of which contributed to the point-plus net daily gain.
"There was a good runup right before that (December T-bond futures) went off," said the second broker.
Gains in the dollar, which popped upward after unexpected shrinkage in the October U.S. trade deficit, plus strong U.S. stock market persuaded some shorts to cover, brokers said.
"It started out with the shortcovering rally, and earlier it (rise) had to do with the dollar's strength and the equities markets," said the first broker.
Unexpected weakness in the December Philadelphia Federal Reserve business conditions index also supported gains. The index fell to a -2.2 versus forecasts for 7.4 reading.
Technically, Thursday's price action for March T-bonds constituted a daily key reversal, where the contract made a lower low, a higher and a higher settlement than on Wednesday.
The brokers said that formation could encourage buyers, although a daily reversal is not necessarily considered a strong or reliable pattern in T-bonds.
The first broker said he saw March T-bonds possibly edging up to test strong resistance at the 113-14/32 - 15/32 area.

March T-bonds closed up 1-03/32 at 113-05/32, notes rose 20/32 to 109-19/32, munis rose 1-03/32 to 116-01/32, bills added four bps to 94.98, Eurodollars rose three bps to 94.45. ((DerivativesDesk(312)408-8750/E-mail:derivatives@reuters.com))
